io.github.zachohara.bukkit.location.locdata

Class LocationDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.zachohara.bukkit.location.locdata.LocationDataManager

  • public class LocationDataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A LocationDataManager object is responsible for managing and storing the location information for all players that are currently offline.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  LocationDataManager.SerializableLocation
      A SerializableLocation object stores the same information as a Location object, but can be serialized if necessary.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.File dataFile
      The address of the file that should be written to.
      private static java.lang.String LOCATION_FILE_PATH
      The name of the file that location information should be written to.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,LocationDataManager.SerializableLocation> locationMap
      A HashMap of location data that is attached to a player's username.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocationDataManager(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin owner)
      Constructs a new LocationDataManager with the given plugin as an owner.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void attemptLoadFile(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin owner)
      Attempts to load currently existant location data from a file.
      private void createDataFile(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin owner)
      Creates a new file for location data if and only if there is not already stored location data under the same filename.
      void loadFromFile()
      Loads stored location data from an external file, so that it can be reconstructed into a usable object form.
      boolean playerLocationExists(java.lang.String playername)
      Tests if there exists location data for a player with the given name.
      org.bukkit.Location retrievePlayerLocation(java.lang.String playername)
      Retrieves the stored location data for a player with the given name, and reconstructs that data into a Location object.
      void saveAllPlayers()
      Saves the location data of all the players currently on the server.
      void savePlayerLocation(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
      Saves the location data for a single player.
      void saveToFile()
      Saves all the stored location data into an external file, so that it can be reconstructed later even if the object information is dumped.

    • Method Detail

      • saveAllPlayers

        public void saveAllPlayers()
        Saves the location data of all the players currently on the server.

      • savePlayerLocation

        public void savePlayerLocation(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Saves the location data for a single player.
        Parameters:
        p - the Player to save the location information for.

      • retrievePlayerLocation

        public org.bukkit.Location retrievePlayerLocation(java.lang.String playername)
        Retrieves the stored location data for a player with the given name, and reconstructs that data into a Location object.
        Parameters:
        playername - the name of the player to return the location of.
        Returns:
        the Location of the given player.

      • playerLocationExists

        public boolean playerLocationExists(java.lang.String playername)
        Tests if there exists location data for a player with the given name.
        Parameters:
        playername - the name of the player to test for.
        Returns:
        true if there is a record of the player's offline location; false otherwise.

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Saves all the stored location data into an external file, so that it can be reconstructed later even if the object information is dumped.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the write operation fails.

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads stored location data from an external file, so that it can be reconstructed into a usable object form.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file read operation fails.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the read is succesful, but the content is not what was expected.

      • createDataFile

        private void createDataFile(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin owner)
        Creates a new file for location data if and only if there is not already stored location data under the same filename.
        Parameters:
        owner - the JavaPlugin that should be informed of errors in this operation.

      • attemptLoadFile

        private void attemptLoadFile(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin owner)
        Attempts to load currently existant location data from a file.
        Parameters:
        owner - the JavaPlugin that should be informed of errors in this operation.
